storyTitle: As Performance Manager, I want to schedule review cycles to achieve timely performance evaluations

functional.title: Successfully schedule a daily review cycle with notification settings
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager with review scheduling permissions
User is on the Review Cycle Management page at /review-cycles/schedule
No existing review cycles are scheduled for the current period
System time is set to a valid business date

steps.action: Click on 'Create New Review Cycle' button in the top-right corner of the page
steps.expectedResult: Review cycle creation modal opens with empty form fields for frequency, start date, notification settings, and description

steps.action: Select 'Daily' from the 'Frequency' dropdown menu
steps.expectedResult: Frequency field displays 'Daily' and additional daily-specific options appear (time of day, weekdays only checkbox)

steps.action: Set start date to tomorrow's date using the date picker and set time to '09:00 AM'
steps.expectedResult: Start date field shows tomorrow's date in MM/DD/YYYY format and time shows '09:00 AM'

steps.action: Enable 'Send Notification' toggle and set notification time to '24 hours before review'
steps.expectedResult: Notification toggle turns green/active and notification timing dropdown shows '24 hours before'

steps.action: Enter 'Daily Performance Check-in' in the 'Review Cycle Name' field and click 'Save Schedule' button
steps.expectedResult: Success message 'Review cycle scheduled successfully' appears in green banner at top of page, modal closes, and new review cycle appears in the calendar view

postconditions: Review cycle is saved in the database with status 'Active'
Calendar view displays the daily review cycle starting from tomorrow
Notification job is created in the system for 24 hours before each review
User remains on the Review Cycle Management page with updated calendar view

functional.title: Successfully schedule a weekly review cycle and verify calendar view display
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager with scheduling permissions
User is on the Review Cycle Management page
Calendar view is set to 'Month' view mode
No conflicting weekly review cycles exist

steps.action: Click 'Create New Review Cycle' button
steps.expectedResult: Review cycle creation modal opens with all required fields visible

steps.action: Select 'Weekly' from the 'Frequency' dropdown and choose 'Monday' as the review day
steps.expectedResult: Frequency shows 'Weekly' and 'Day of Week' dropdown displays 'Monday' selected

steps.action: Set start date to next Monday, enter 'Weekly Team Review' as name, and click 'Save Schedule'
steps.expectedResult: Success message appears, modal closes, and calendar view shows recurring Monday markers for the weekly review cycle

steps.action: Navigate through calendar months using next/previous arrows to view future scheduled reviews
steps.expectedResult: Calendar displays weekly review markers on every Monday for the next 3 months with 'Weekly Team Review' label on hover

postconditions: Weekly review cycle is saved with recurrence pattern set to 'Every Monday'
Calendar view shows all upcoming Monday reviews for the configured period
Review cycle appears in the 'Active Schedules' list with frequency 'Weekly'
System creates individual review instances for each Monday in the schedule

functional.title: Successfully schedule a monthly review cycle with custom notification timing
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager
User has access to the Review Cycle Management page
At least one employee exists in the system to be reviewed
Email notification service is configured and active

steps.action: Navigate to Review Cycle Management page and click 'Create New Review Cycle' button
steps.expectedResult: Review cycle creation modal opens successfully

steps.action: Select 'Monthly' from frequency dropdown and choose '1st day of month' from the 'Day of Month' dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Monthly frequency is selected and day selector shows '1st day of month'

steps.action: Enable notifications toggle, select '72 hours before review' from notification timing dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Notification settings expand showing '72 hours before' selected and email template preview appears

steps.action: Enter 'Monthly Performance Evaluation' as review name, add description 'Comprehensive monthly review of team performance', and click 'Save Schedule'
steps.expectedResult: Success message 'Review cycle scheduled successfully' displays, modal closes, and monthly review appears on calendar on the 1st of each month

steps.action: Click on the newly created review cycle in the calendar view
steps.expectedResult: Review cycle details panel opens showing frequency 'Monthly', notification timing '72 hours before', and description text

postconditions: Monthly review cycle is saved with recurrence on 1st of each month
Notification jobs are scheduled for 72 hours before each monthly review date
Review cycle appears in both calendar view and active schedules list
System logs the creation action with timestamp and user details

functional.title: Edit an existing scheduled review cycle and verify changes are reflected
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager
At least one active review cycle exists (e.g., 'Weekly Team Review' scheduled for Mondays)
User is on the Review Cycle Management page with calendar view visible
No reviews from this cycle are currently in progress

steps.action: Click on the existing 'Weekly Team Review' cycle in the calendar view
steps.expectedResult: Review cycle details panel opens on the right side showing current settings: frequency 'Weekly', day 'Monday', notification settings

steps.action: Click 'Edit' button in the details panel
steps.expectedResult: Edit review cycle modal opens with all current values pre-populated in the form fields

steps.action: Change frequency from 'Weekly' to 'Bi-weekly' and change day from 'Monday' to 'Friday'
steps.expectedResult: Frequency dropdown shows 'Bi-weekly' and day dropdown shows 'Friday' selected

steps.action: Change notification timing from '24 hours before' to '48 hours before' and click 'Save Changes' button
steps.expectedResult: Success message 'Review cycle updated successfully' appears, modal closes, and calendar refreshes showing reviews on alternating Fridays

steps.action: Click on the updated review cycle in calendar to view details
steps.expectedResult: Details panel shows updated frequency 'Bi-weekly', day 'Friday', and notification timing '48 hours before'

postconditions: Review cycle is updated in database with new frequency and day settings
Old notification jobs are cancelled and new ones are created for 48 hours before each bi-weekly Friday
Calendar view displays reviews on alternating Fridays instead of every Monday
Audit log records the modification with old and new values, timestamp, and user who made the change

functional.title: Delete a scheduled review cycle and verify removal from calendar
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager with delete permissions
At least one scheduled review cycle exists that has not started yet
User is on the Review Cycle Management page
No completed reviews exist for the cycle to be deleted

steps.action: Locate the review cycle 'Daily Performance Check-in' in the Active Schedules list and click on it
steps.expectedResult: Review cycle details panel opens showing all cycle information and action buttons including 'Delete'

steps.action: Click the 'Delete' button with trash icon
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog appears with message 'Are you sure you want to delete this review cycle? This action cannot be undone.' and buttons 'Cancel' and 'Delete'

steps.action: Click 'Delete' button in the confirmation dialog
steps.expectedResult: Success message 'Review cycle deleted successfully' appears in green banner, confirmation dialog closes, and review cycle disappears from the Active Schedules list

steps.action: Check the calendar view for any remaining instances of the deleted review cycle
steps.expectedResult: Calendar view no longer shows any markers or entries for 'Daily Performance Check-in' review cycle

postconditions: Review cycle is marked as deleted in the database with deletion timestamp
All future scheduled review instances are cancelled
All associated notification jobs are removed from the notification queue
Calendar view is updated and no longer displays the deleted review cycle

functional.title: Verify notification is sent to users prior to scheduled review cycle
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager
A review cycle is scheduled for tomorrow at 10:00 AM with notification set to '24 hours before'
Test user email account is accessible for verification
Email notification service is running and configured correctly
System time can be advanced for testing purposes

steps.action: Navigate to Review Cycle Management page and verify the scheduled review cycle 'Monthly Performance Evaluation' is set for tomorrow at 10:00 AM
steps.expectedResult: Calendar shows review scheduled for tomorrow with notification icon indicating '24 hours before' notification is enabled

steps.action: Advance system time to 24 hours before the scheduled review (today at 10:00 AM) or wait for scheduled notification time
steps.expectedResult: System time is advanced successfully or current time matches notification trigger time

steps.action: Check the in-app notifications bell icon in the top-right corner of the application
steps.expectedResult: Notification badge shows '1' new notification and clicking it displays 'Upcoming Review: Monthly Performance Evaluation scheduled for tomorrow at 10:00 AM'

steps.action: Check the registered email inbox for notification email
steps.expectedResult: Email received with subject 'Reminder: Performance Review Scheduled for Tomorrow' containing review cycle name, date, time, and preparation instructions

steps.action: Click on the notification in the app to view full details
steps.expectedResult: Notification expands showing full review details with link to 'View Review Cycle' that navigates to the review cycle details page

postconditions: Notification is marked as sent in the database with timestamp
Email is delivered successfully to all participants in the review cycle
In-app notification remains visible until dismissed by user
Notification log records successful delivery with recipient list and delivery status

negative.title: Attempt to schedule review cycle with overlapping dates and verify validation error
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager
An existing daily review cycle 'Daily Check-in' is already scheduled starting from today
User is on the Review Cycle Management page
Validation rules for overlapping cycles are active

steps.action: Click 'Create New Review Cycle' button to open the creation modal
steps.expectedResult: Review cycle creation modal opens with empty form fields

steps.action: Select 'Daily' frequency, set start date to today (same as existing cycle), enter name 'Duplicate Daily Review', and click 'Save Schedule'
steps.expectedResult: Error message appears in red banner at top of modal stating 'Cannot create review cycle: Overlapping schedule detected with existing cycle Daily Check-in. Please choose a different frequency or start date.'

steps.action: Verify the 'Save Schedule' button remains enabled and form fields retain entered values
steps.expectedResult: Form remains open with all entered data intact, Save button is still clickable, and no review cycle is created

steps.action: Check the calendar view and Active Schedules list for the attempted duplicate cycle
steps.expectedResult: Calendar and Active Schedules list show only the original 'Daily Check-in' cycle, no duplicate entry exists

postconditions: No new review cycle is created in the database
Existing review cycle 'Daily Check-in' remains unchanged
User remains on the creation modal with error message displayed
System logs the validation failure with details of the overlap conflict

negative.title: Attempt to schedule review cycle without required fields and verify validation errors
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager
User is on the Review Cycle Management page
No form fields are pre-filled
Client-side and server-side validation are both active

steps.action: Click 'Create New Review Cycle' button to open the creation modal
steps.expectedResult: Review cycle creation modal opens with all fields empty and no validation errors displayed initially

steps.action: Leave all fields empty (frequency, start date, review name) and immediately click 'Save Schedule' button
steps.expectedResult: Multiple validation error messages appear: 'Frequency is required' below frequency dropdown, 'Start date is required' below date picker, 'Review cycle name is required' below name field, all in red text

steps.action: Verify the modal remains open and no API call is made to the backend
steps.expectedResult: Modal stays open with all validation errors visible, network tab shows no POST request to /api/review-cycles/schedule, and no success message appears

steps.action: Check the calendar view and database for any new review cycle entries
steps.expectedResult: Calendar view shows no new entries and database query confirms no new review cycle record was created

postconditions: No review cycle is created in the database
User remains on the creation modal with validation errors displayed
All form fields remain empty as originally left
No notification jobs are created

negative.title: Attempt to schedule review cycle with past start date and verify error handling
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager
User is on the Review Cycle Management page with creation modal open
Current system date is known and accessible
Date validation rules prevent past dates

steps.action: In the review cycle creation modal, select 'Weekly' from frequency dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Frequency field shows 'Weekly' and day of week selector appears

steps.action: Manually enter a past date (e.g., last week's date) in the start date field or select it from date picker if allowed
steps.expectedResult: Date field shows the past date entered

steps.action: Enter 'Past Date Test Review' as review name and click 'Save Schedule' button
steps.expectedResult: Error message appears stating 'Start date cannot be in the past. Please select a current or future date.' in red text below the date field or in error banner

steps.action: Verify no review cycle is created by checking the calendar view and Active Schedules list
steps.expectedResult: No new review cycle appears in calendar or schedules list, confirming validation prevented creation

postconditions: No review cycle is saved to the database
User remains on the creation modal with error message visible
Form retains all entered values except the invalid date may be cleared
System logs the validation failure with attempted past date value

negative.title: Attempt to access review cycle scheduling without proper permissions and verify access denial
preconditions: User is logged in as a regular Employee (not Performance Manager)
User does not have 'schedule_review_cycles' permission in their role
Role-based access control is enforced on both frontend and backend
User is on the main dashboard or any accessible page

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to Review Cycle Management page by entering URL /review-cycles/schedule directly in browser
steps.expectedResult: Page redirects to 403 Forbidden error page or dashboard with error message 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to schedule review cycles. Please contact your administrator.'

steps.action: Check the main navigation menu for any links to Review Cycle Management
steps.expectedResult: Navigation menu does not display 'Review Cycles' or 'Schedule Reviews' options for users without proper permissions

steps.action: Attempt to make a direct API call to POST /api/review-cycles/schedule using browser console or API testing tool with valid review cycle data
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden status code with response body containing error message 'Insufficient permissions to perform this action'

steps.action: Verify no review cycle is created by logging in as Performance Manager and checking the calendar view
steps.expectedResult: Calendar view shows no unauthorized review cycles were created, confirming backend security prevented the action

postconditions: No review cycle is created in the database
User remains on error page or is redirected to authorized page
Security log records the unauthorized access attempt with user ID, timestamp, and attempted action
User's session remains active but access to scheduling features remains blocked

negative.title: Attempt to delete a review cycle that has already started and verify prevention
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager
A review cycle 'Q1 Performance Review' exists with start date in the past (already started)
At least one review instance from this cycle has been completed or is in progress
User is on the Review Cycle Management page

steps.action: Locate the active review cycle 'Q1 Performance Review' in the Active Schedules list and click on it
steps.expectedResult: Review cycle details panel opens showing cycle information with status 'In Progress' or 'Active'

steps.action: Click the 'Delete' button in the details panel
steps.expectedResult: Error message appears stating 'Cannot delete review cycle: This cycle has already started and contains completed or in-progress reviews. You can only deactivate it.' Delete button may be disabled or grayed out

steps.action: Verify the review cycle still exists in the Active Schedules list and calendar view
steps.expectedResult: Review cycle 'Q1 Performance Review' remains visible in both Active Schedules list and calendar with all scheduled reviews intact

steps.action: Check if an alternative 'Deactivate' or 'End Cycle' option is available instead of delete
steps.expectedResult: Details panel shows 'Deactivate' button as an alternative action for cycles that have already started

postconditions: Review cycle remains in the database with status unchanged
All completed and in-progress reviews associated with the cycle remain intact
Calendar view continues to show the review cycle
System logs the failed deletion attempt with reason 'Cycle already started'

negative.title: Attempt to schedule review cycle with invalid frequency value and verify error handling
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager
User has browser developer tools access for testing
Review cycle creation modal is open
API validation is active on the backend

steps.action: Open browser developer tools and inspect the frequency dropdown element in the review cycle creation form
steps.expectedResult: Frequency dropdown HTML element is visible in the inspector with valid options (Daily, Weekly, Monthly)

steps.action: Using browser console, manually modify the frequency dropdown value to an invalid option 'Hourly' or inject a custom value not in the allowed list
steps.expectedResult: Dropdown value is changed to 'Hourly' in the DOM

steps.action: Fill in other required fields (start date as tomorrow, name as 'Invalid Frequency Test') and click 'Save Schedule' button
steps.expectedResult: Error message appears stating 'Invalid frequency selected. Please choose from: Daily, Weekly, or Monthly.' or API returns 400 Bad Request with validation error

steps.action: Verify no review cycle is created by checking the calendar view and making a database query
steps.expectedResult: No new review cycle appears in calendar, and database confirms no record was created with invalid frequency value

postconditions: No review cycle is saved to the database
User sees validation error message on the form
System logs the validation failure with details of invalid frequency value attempted
Form remains open allowing user to correct the frequency selection

negative.title: Attempt to schedule review cycle during system maintenance and verify graceful error handling
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager
Backend API is temporarily unavailable or in maintenance mode (simulated or actual)
User is on the Review Cycle Management page with creation modal open
Network timeout is set to 30 seconds

steps.action: Fill in all required fields: select 'Monthly' frequency, set start date to next month, enter name 'Maintenance Test Review', enable notifications
steps.expectedResult: All form fields are populated with valid data

steps.action: Simulate backend unavailability (disconnect network or use API mocking tool to return 503 Service Unavailable) and click 'Save Schedule' button
steps.expectedResult: Loading spinner appears on the Save button indicating request is being processed

steps.action: Wait for the request to timeout or receive error response from backend
steps.expectedResult: Error message appears stating 'Unable to schedule review cycle. The system is currently unavailable. Please try again later.' with a 'Retry' button option

steps.action: Verify no review cycle is created by checking calendar view and attempting to refresh the page
steps.expectedResult: Calendar shows no new review cycle, and after page refresh, the attempted cycle does not appear in Active Schedules list

steps.action: Click the 'Retry' button if available to test retry functionality
steps.expectedResult: System attempts to resubmit the request, and if backend is still unavailable, same error message appears again

postconditions: No review cycle is created in the database due to system unavailability
User remains on the creation modal with error message and retry option
Form data is preserved allowing user to retry without re-entering information
System logs the failed attempt with error details (503 Service Unavailable, timestamp, user ID)

edgeCases.title: Schedule review cycle at exact midnight boundary across time zones
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager with scheduling permissions
System is configured with multiple time zones (PST, EST, GMT)
Review cycle management page is loaded and responsive
No existing review cycles are scheduled for the target date

steps.action: Navigate to review cycle management page and click 'Schedule New Review Cycle' button
steps.expectedResult: Review cycle scheduling modal opens with all frequency options visible

steps.action: Select 'Monthly' frequency from dropdown and set start date to exactly 12:00:00 AM (midnight) on the 1st of next month
steps.expectedResult: Date picker accepts midnight time and displays '12:00:00 AM' in the time field

steps.action: Select time zone as 'PST (UTC-8)' from time zone dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Time zone is set to PST and system shows equivalent times in other zones (3:00 AM EST, 8:00 AM GMT)

steps.action: Click 'Save Review Cycle' button
steps.expectedResult: Success message 'Review cycle scheduled successfully' appears in green banner at top of page

steps.action: Navigate to calendar view and verify the scheduled review appears at midnight PST
steps.expectedResult: Review cycle appears on calendar at 12:00 AM PST on the 1st, with correct time zone indicator displayed

postconditions: Review cycle is saved in database with exact midnight timestamp in PST
Calendar view displays the review cycle at correct time across all time zones
Notification scheduler has queued reminder notifications based on PST midnight time
User remains on review cycle management page with calendar view active

edgeCases.title: Schedule maximum number of concurrent review cycles (100+) and verify system performance
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager with full scheduling permissions
Database has capacity for at least 150 review cycle records
Review cycle management page loads within 2 seconds baseline
System performance monitoring tools are active

steps.action: Navigate to review cycle management page and note initial page load time
steps.expectedResult: Page loads in under 2 seconds with empty or minimal review cycles displayed

steps.action: Use bulk scheduling feature or API to create 100 review cycles with different frequencies (daily, weekly, monthly) spanning next 12 months
steps.expectedResult: System processes bulk creation request and displays progress indicator showing '100 review cycles created successfully'

steps.action: Refresh the review cycle management page and measure load time
steps.expectedResult: Page loads in under 2 seconds despite 100 review cycles, with pagination or lazy loading implemented

steps.action: Navigate to calendar view and scroll through all months containing scheduled reviews
steps.expectedResult: Calendar renders smoothly without lag, displaying all 100 review cycles with appropriate visual indicators for overlapping dates

steps.action: Attempt to schedule 51st additional review cycle to exceed typical limits
steps.expectedResult: System either accepts the 101st review cycle or displays clear message indicating maximum limit reached with current count

postconditions: All 100+ review cycles are persisted in database with correct scheduling data
System performance remains within acceptable limits (page load under 2 seconds)
Calendar view displays all review cycles without data loss or rendering issues
No memory leaks or performance degradation observed in browser console

edgeCases.title: Schedule review cycle on February 29th (leap year) and verify behavior in non-leap years
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager
Current system date is within a leap year (e.g., 2024)
Review cycle management page is accessible
System calendar includes February 29th as selectable date

steps.action: Navigate to review cycle management page and click 'Schedule New Review Cycle' button
steps.expectedResult: Review cycle scheduling modal opens with date picker showing current leap year calendar

steps.action: Select 'Yearly' frequency from dropdown and set start date to February 29th, 2024
steps.expectedResult: Date picker accepts February 29th and displays it in the selected date field

steps.action: Set recurrence to repeat annually for next 5 years and click 'Save Review Cycle'
steps.expectedResult: Success message appears and system saves the yearly recurring review cycle starting Feb 29, 2024

steps.action: Navigate to calendar view and advance to February 2025 (non-leap year)
steps.expectedResult: System displays review cycle on February 28th, 2025 with notation 'Adjusted from Feb 29 (non-leap year)' or similar indicator

steps.action: Advance calendar to February 2028 (next leap year) and verify review cycle date
steps.expectedResult: Review cycle appears on February 29th, 2028 as originally scheduled

postconditions: Review cycle is saved with original February 29th date preserved in database
System intelligently adjusts to February 28th in non-leap years without data corruption
Calendar view correctly displays adjusted dates with clear user notifications
Recurring pattern maintains integrity across leap year boundaries

edgeCases.title: Schedule overlapping review cycles with identical start times and verify validation
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager
One review cycle already exists scheduled for January 15, 2025 at 9:00 AM
Review cycle management page is loaded
System validation rules for overlapping cycles are active

steps.action: Navigate to review cycle management page and click 'Schedule New Review Cycle' button
steps.expectedResult: Review cycle scheduling modal opens with empty form fields

steps.action: Select 'Weekly' frequency and set start date to January 15, 2025 at 9:00 AM (exact same as existing cycle)
steps.expectedResult: Date and time fields accept the input without immediate validation error

steps.action: Fill in all required fields (review name, participants, duration) and click 'Save Review Cycle' button
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error message 'A review cycle is already scheduled for this date and time. Please choose a different time or edit the existing cycle.' in red banner

steps.action: Modify start time to 9:01 AM (1 minute after existing cycle) and click 'Save Review Cycle' again
steps.expectedResult: System accepts the schedule if cycles don't overlap in duration, or shows error if overlap detected based on cycle duration

steps.action: Navigate to calendar view and verify both review cycles are displayed if second was accepted
steps.expectedResult: Calendar shows both review cycles with visual indication of proximity (e.g., stacked or adjacent time slots)

postconditions: System enforces no-overlap validation rule as specified in technical requirements
Only valid non-overlapping review cycles are saved to database
Clear error messages guide user to resolve scheduling conflicts
Calendar view accurately reflects all successfully scheduled review cycles

edgeCases.title: Rapidly create and delete multiple review cycles in quick succession (stress test)
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager with full permissions
Review cycle management page is loaded and responsive
Network connection is stable
Browser console is open to monitor for errors

steps.action: Navigate to review cycle management page and open browser developer console to monitor network requests
steps.expectedResult: Page loads successfully and console shows no errors

steps.action: Rapidly click 'Schedule New Review Cycle' button, fill minimum required fields, and click 'Save' 10 times in under 30 seconds
steps.expectedResult: System processes all 10 requests without crashing, showing success messages for each or queuing requests appropriately

steps.action: Immediately after creation, select all 10 newly created review cycles and click 'Delete' button
steps.expectedResult: System displays confirmation dialog 'Are you sure you want to delete 10 review cycles?' with 'Confirm' and 'Cancel' buttons

steps.action: Click 'Confirm' button to delete all 10 review cycles simultaneously
steps.expectedResult: System processes deletion request and displays success message 'Successfully deleted 10 review cycles' without errors

steps.action: Check browser console for any JavaScript errors, failed API calls, or memory warnings
steps.expectedResult: Console shows no critical errors, all API calls return successful status codes (200/204), no memory leaks detected

steps.action: Refresh the page and verify review cycle list is accurate and page loads within 2 seconds
steps.expectedResult: Page refreshes successfully, deleted review cycles are not displayed, and load time remains under 2 seconds

postconditions: All created review cycles are properly persisted or rolled back if errors occurred
Deleted review cycles are removed from database with proper cascade deletion of related records
System remains stable with no memory leaks or performance degradation
Database integrity is maintained with no orphaned records or inconsistent state

edgeCases.title: Schedule review cycle while system clock changes during daylight saving time transition
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager
System is configured for a time zone that observes daylight saving time (e.g., PST/PDT)
Test is performed during or simulated for DST transition period (spring forward or fall back)
Review cycle management page is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to review cycle management page at 1:30 AM on DST transition day (when clocks spring forward at 2:00 AM)
steps.expectedResult: Page loads successfully with current system time displayed correctly

steps.action: Click 'Schedule New Review Cycle' and set start time to 2:30 AM (during the 'lost hour' of spring forward)
steps.expectedResult: System either prevents selection of non-existent time or automatically adjusts to 3:30 AM with notification 'Time adjusted for daylight saving transition'

steps.action: Select 'Weekly' frequency for recurring review and click 'Save Review Cycle' button
steps.expectedResult: Success message appears and review cycle is saved with DST-aware timestamp

steps.action: Navigate to calendar view and verify the scheduled review appears at correct adjusted time
steps.expectedResult: Calendar displays review cycle at 3:30 AM (or appropriate adjusted time) with DST indicator if applicable

steps.action: Check notification settings to verify reminder notifications account for DST transition
steps.expectedResult: Notification scheduler shows correct times adjusted for DST, ensuring reminders are sent at appropriate local times

postconditions: Review cycle is saved with UTC timestamp that correctly accounts for DST transition
All recurring instances of the review cycle maintain correct local time across DST boundaries
Notification system schedules reminders with DST-aware calculations
No duplicate or skipped review cycles occur due to DST transitions

accessibility.title: Complete keyboard navigation through entire review cycle scheduling workflow
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager
Review cycle management page is loaded
No mouse or pointing device is used for this test
Screen reader is available but not required for this test

steps.action: Press Tab key repeatedly from page load to navigate through all interactive elements on review cycle management page
steps.expectedResult: Focus indicator (visible outline or highlight) moves sequentially through all interactive elements: navigation menu, 'Schedule New Review Cycle' button, existing review cycle items, edit/delete buttons, calendar navigation controls

steps.action: When focus reaches 'Schedule New Review Cycle' button, press Enter or Space key to activate
steps.expectedResult: Review cycle scheduling modal opens and focus automatically moves to first input field (review cycle name) with visible focus indicator

steps.action: Press Tab to navigate through all form fields: cycle name, frequency dropdown, date picker, time picker, notification settings
steps.expectedResult: Focus moves logically through all form fields in reading order, each field shows clear focus indicator, no focus traps encountered

steps.action: When focus reaches frequency dropdown, press Space or Enter to open, use Arrow keys to select 'Monthly', press Enter to confirm
steps.expectedResult: Dropdown opens on Space/Enter, Arrow keys navigate options with visual and programmatic focus, Enter selects option and closes dropdown, focus returns to dropdown trigger

steps.action: Navigate to date picker field, press Enter to open calendar widget, use Arrow keys to navigate dates, Enter to select
steps.expectedResult: Calendar widget opens, Arrow keys move between dates (Left/Right for days, Up/Down for weeks), current focused date is clearly highlighted, Enter selects date and closes calendar

steps.action: Tab to 'Save Review Cycle' button and press Enter, then press Escape key
steps.expectedResult: Enter activates save action, success message appears and is keyboard accessible, Escape key closes modal and returns focus to 'Schedule New Review Cycle' button on main page

steps.action: Navigate to calendar view using Tab, use Arrow keys to navigate between dates and scheduled reviews
steps.expectedResult: Calendar is keyboard navigable, Arrow keys move between dates, Enter opens review details, all interactive elements are reachable via keyboard

postconditions: All functionality is fully accessible via keyboard without requiring mouse
Focus order is logical and follows visual layout
No keyboard traps prevent user from navigating away from any element
Focus indicators are visible at all times during navigation

accessibility.title: Screen reader announces all review cycle information and state changes correctly
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager
Screen reader is active (NVDA, JAWS, or VoiceOver)
Review cycle management page is loaded
At least one review cycle is already scheduled for testing

steps.action: Navigate to review cycle management page and listen to screen reader announcement when page loads
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces page title 'Review Cycle Management', main heading level 1, and summary 'You have X scheduled review cycles' with appropriate ARIA live region

steps.action: Navigate to 'Schedule New Review Cycle' button using screen reader navigation commands

reliability.title: Database Connection Failure During Review Cycle Scheduling with Automatic Recovery
reliability.description: Validate system resilience when database connection fails during review cycle scheduling operation. Test circuit breaker activation, graceful degradation, transaction rollback, and automatic recovery. Verify that no partial data is committed and user receives appropriate error messaging with retry capability.
preconditions: Performance Manager is authenticated with scheduling permissions
Review cycle management page is accessible
Database monitoring tools are configured
Circuit breaker is enabled for database connections
Baseline MTTR target is 30 seconds

steps.action: Navigate to review cycle management page and configure a quarterly review cycle with start date, frequency, and notification settings
steps.expectedResult: Review cycle configuration form loads successfully within 2 seconds with all fields populated

steps.action: Inject database connection failure using chaos engineering tool (e.g., Gremlin, Chaos Monkey) to simulate network partition to database
steps.expectedResult: Database connection is severed, simulating real-world failure scenario

steps.action: Click 'Save Review Cycle Schedule' button to submit the POST /api/review-cycles/schedule request
steps.expectedResult: System detects database unavailability within 3 seconds, circuit breaker opens, and user-friendly error message displays: 'Unable to save review cycle. Please try again in a moment.' No partial data is committed to database

steps.action: Verify transaction rollback by checking database logs and monitoring dashboards for uncommitted transactions
steps.expectedResult: All transaction changes are rolled back completely, no orphaned records exist, database integrity is maintained

steps.action: Restore database connection and click retry button or resubmit the review cycle schedule
steps.expectedResult: System detects database availability, circuit breaker transitions to half-open state, request succeeds, review cycle is saved successfully with confirmation message

steps.action: Measure and record MTTR (Mean Time To Recovery) from failure injection to successful operation
steps.expectedResult: MTTR is less than 30 seconds, meeting SLO target. System availability remains above 99.5% during incident

postconditions: Database connection is restored to normal state
Circuit breaker returns to closed state
Review cycle data is consistent and complete
No data corruption or partial records exist
System logs capture failure and recovery events
Monitoring alerts are triggered and resolved

reliability.title: Notification Service Failure During Scheduled Review Cycle Execution with Retry Logic Validation
reliability.description: Execute chaos experiment to validate system behavior when notification service becomes unavailable during scheduled review cycle execution. Test retry mechanism with exponential backoff, dead letter queue handling, and eventual consistency. Verify that review cycle execution continues despite notification failures and notifications are queued for retry without blocking primary workflow.
preconditions: Review cycle is already scheduled and active in the system
Notification service is operational with message queue configured
Retry policy is configured with exponential backoff (initial: 5s, max: 60s, max attempts: 5)
Dead letter queue is configured for failed notifications
Steady state hypothesis: 85% of scheduled reviews occur on time regardless of notification service status

steps.action: Establish steady state baseline by verifying that scheduled review cycle triggers successfully and notifications are sent to 50 managers
steps.expectedResult: Review cycle executes on schedule, all 50 notification requests are processed successfully within 10 seconds, baseline metrics recorded

steps.action: Define blast radius: Limit chaos experiment to notification service only, excluding core review cycle scheduling service
steps.expectedResult: Chaos experiment scope is isolated to notification microservice, primary scheduling service remains unaffected

steps.action: Inject notification service failure by shutting down notification API endpoint or introducing 100% error rate for 5 minutes
steps.expectedResult: Notification service returns 503 Service Unavailable errors, simulating complete service outage

steps.action: Trigger scheduled review cycle execution and monitor system behavior during notification service outage
steps.expectedResult: Review cycle executes successfully on schedule, notification requests fail gracefully, messages are queued in retry queue with exponential backoff, no exceptions bubble up to user interface, review cycle status shows 'Active' with notification status 'Pending'

steps.action: Verify retry mechanism attempts with exponential backoff pattern (5s, 10s, 20s, 40s, 60s) and monitor dead letter queue
steps.expectedResult: System attempts retries according to configured policy, failed notifications after 5 attempts move to dead letter queue, retry metrics are logged correctly

steps.action: Restore notification service to operational state and observe recovery behavior
steps.expectedResult: Queued notifications are processed successfully within 2 minutes of service restoration, eventual consistency is achieved, 85% SLO for on-time reviews is maintained (review cycles executed on time despite notification delays)

steps.action: Validate steady state hypothesis: Confirm that review cycle execution rate remains at or above 85% on-time completion
steps.expectedResult: Hypothesis validated: 85%+ of scheduled reviews occurred on time, proving system resilience to notification service failures. MTBF for notification service is recorded, system demonstrates graceful degradation

postconditions: Notification service is restored to normal operation
All queued notifications are successfully delivered
Dead letter queue is reviewed and processed
Retry metrics are captured in monitoring system
Chaos experiment results are documented
System returns to steady state with 85%+ on-time review completion

reliability.title: API Gateway Failover and Load Balancer Resilience During Peak Review Cycle Scheduling Load
reliability.description: Validate automatic failover capabilities and zero-downtime deployment when primary API gateway instance fails during peak load of concurrent review cycle scheduling requests. Test load balancer health checks, automatic traffic rerouting, session persistence, and RTO compliance. Verify that in-flight requests are not lost and system maintains 99.9% availability SLO.
preconditions: Multi-instance API gateway deployment with minimum 3 instances behind load balancer
Load balancer health checks configured with 5-second interval
Session persistence/sticky sessions are configured
RTO target is 15 seconds for API gateway failover
RPO target is zero data loss for in-flight transactions
Baseline availability SLO is 99.9% (43 minutes downtime per month maximum)

steps.action: Generate peak load simulation with 200 concurrent Performance Managers scheduling review cycles simultaneously via POST /api/review-cycles/schedule
steps.expectedResult: All 3 API gateway instances are handling requests, load is distributed evenly (33% each), response times are under 2 seconds, success rate is 100%

steps.action: Monitor baseline metrics: request distribution, response times, error rates, and active connections across all gateway instances
steps.expectedResult: Baseline metrics recorded: Average response time 1.2s, 0% error rate, 200 active sessions distributed across instances

steps.action: Abruptly terminate primary API gateway instance (handling 33% of traffic) to simulate catastrophic failure
steps.expectedResult: Primary instance stops responding immediately, simulating crash or infrastructure failure

steps.action: Observe load balancer health check detection and automatic failover behavior
steps.expectedResult: Load balancer detects failed instance within 5-10 seconds (2 failed health checks), automatically removes instance from rotation, traffic is redistributed to remaining 2 healthy instances

steps.action: Monitor in-flight requests that were being processed by failed instance and verify retry/recovery mechanisms
steps.expectedResult: In-flight requests are either completed successfully via connection draining or automatically retried by client/API layer, zero requests result in data loss, users may experience brief delay (5-10s) but no failed transactions

steps.action: Measure RTO by recording time from instance failure to full traffic recovery on remaining instances
steps.expectedResult: RTO is 15 seconds or less from failure detection to complete traffic redistribution, meeting SLO target

steps.action: Verify data integrity by checking that all review cycle schedules submitted during failover are correctly saved without duplicates or data corruption
steps.expectedResult: 100% of review cycle schedules are saved correctly, no duplicate entries, no partial records, RPO of zero data loss is achieved

steps.action: Calculate availability impact and verify SLO compliance: (Total time - Downtime) / Total time * 100
steps.expectedResult: Availability remains at or above 99.9% for the test period, maximum user-perceived downtime is 15 seconds, SLO is maintained

steps.action: Restore failed API gateway instance and verify automatic re-integration into load balancer pool
steps.expectedResult: Restored instance passes health checks, is automatically added back to rotation, load redistributes evenly across all 3 instances

postconditions: All API gateway instances are operational and healthy
Load balancer routing is restored to normal distribution
No data loss or corruption occurred during failover
All review cycle schedules are verified in database
Failover metrics are captured and logged
Availability SLO of 99.9% is maintained
Incident is documented with RTO and RPO measurements

User navigates to the review cycle management page. 2. User selects frequency for review cycles. 3. User saves the review cycle schedule. 4. System confirms the schedule has been saved.
